*div1 type="summary"* *p*Aylett C. Buckner to Austin, August 10, 1825. Desiring Austin's good offices in a dispute with James Cummins.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="08-10-1825">10th August 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col° Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*0 my friend if the espression may be applyed; There is an affair existing between *person_mentioned*J. Cummings*/person_mentioned* and myself: which I wish and must have settled, My hart Cannot sustain the burthen which it now has to support: As I told you a few days ago never can I brook to impositions from any man much less from a man of *person_mentioned*Cumming*/person_mentioned*'s standing; Never the less I will condecend to meet him at any hour on or before the setting of the present sun that my hart may bleed out its vengeance and be releaved of that torment with which I am so deeply oppressed—*/p*
*p*I would have suggested the affair *date_mentioned n="08-09-1825">yesterday */date_mentioned*but I was not disposed to bring about any confusion while you were executing the functions of your office*/p*
*p*Whenever I leave this world I wish to be buryed under my own soil I therefore wish to purchase or make arrangements for *location_mentioned*one thousand acres of Land*/location_mentioned* Yours with the highest Esteem and respect*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Aylett C Buckner*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
